messages.subject: Teacher Discounts
messages.msgSnippet: I emailed Amazon.com about a homeschoolers discount.  Here is the response I received.  I don t really understand it though. Does it make sense to anyone? Ann
messages.messageBody:
I emailed Amazon.com about a homeschoolers discount. Here is the
response I received. I don't really understand it though.
Does it make sense to anyone?
Ann


Greetings from Amazon.com!

Because we are a retailer, and not a wholesaler, the discounts listed
in our catalog, like the payment methods we are able to accept, apply
to all of our customers--individual, educational, institutional, and
corporate alike.

If you have further questions, Customer Service can be reached 24
hours a day:

orders@...
U.S. and Canada: 1-800-201-7575
International: 1-206-266-2992
Fax: 1-206-266-2950

Please don't hesitate to contact us should you have any further
questions, and thanks for your interest in shopping at Amazon.com!


Best regards,

Christopher Strode
Amazon.com
Earth's Biggest Selection
http://www.amazon.com
==============================
Check your order and more! http://www.amazon.com/your-account
Questions? We have your answers! http://www.amazon.com/help


>Subject: Homeschool discounts?
>To: orders@...
>X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.7 [en] (Win98; U)
>From: "A. Yates" <hooperck@...>
>Date: Fri, 07 Apr 2000 20:57:30 -0400
>
>I am a homeschooling mother of 3. Our local bookstores all offer
>discounts for homeschoolers, and I'm wondering if you do too?
>If you do, please tell me how I redeem the discount when ordering.
>Thank You,
>Ann Yates
>
>

messages.subject: Teacher Discounts
messages.msgSnippet: To recive Teacher discounts at some stores they require a paystub to verify employment. Teacher Discounts are sometimes left up to the clerk, so if it does not
messages.messageBody:
To recive Teacher discounts at some stores they require a paystub to
verify employment.
Teacher Discounts are sometimes left up to the clerk, so if it does
not work the first time try again another day with someone else.
There are also some organizations that are tax exempt and also can
use a teachers discount that is when materials are really cheep!
I have been able to use both of these at a discount book store. Our
group was able to buy brand new book listed at $24.99 for $3.00.
What a great deal
Stephanie H. in NY
